SceneText.FriendlyName: Capital City Balka - Inn - Grocery Store

Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: 食材屋「万感の実り」
Entry.EnglishText: Grocer

Entry.JapaneseText: 宿屋「カレギアの栄光」
Entry.EnglishText: Innkeeper

Entry.JapaneseText: カレギア兵
Entry.EnglishText: Callegean Soldier

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>
Entry.EnglishText: <Eugene>

Entry.JapaneseText: 首都バルカ
Entry.EnglishText: Capital City Balka

Entry.JapaneseText: 首都バルカ・宿屋・食材屋
Entry.EnglishText: Capital City Balka - Inn - Grocery Store

Entry.JapaneseText: 宿屋・食材屋
Entry.EnglishText: Inn - Grocery Store

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: お嬢さん、何の用かね？ お金がないと、買い物はできんよ。
Entry.EnglishText: What do you want, young lady? I can't sell you anything if you have no money.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマには売らん事にしたんじゃ。 悪いけど、帰っておくれ。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm not selling anything to Gajuma. I'm sorry, but you need to leave.

Entry.JapaneseText: バルカ唯一の食材屋へ ようこそ！
Entry.EnglishText: Welcome to Balka's only grocery store!

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 食材を買う 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Buy Ingredients Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: 売り切れる前に 買いに来ておくれよ！
Entry.EnglishText: Make sure to buy before I'm sold out!

Entry.JapaneseText: バルカの食材屋はウチだけ！ お忘れなく！
Entry.EnglishText: We're the only grocery store in Balka! Don't you forget it!

Entry.JapaneseText: お城の食材もうちで 扱ってるんだよ。 見ていっておくれ。
Entry.EnglishText: Even the castle procures ingredients from us. Why don't you have a look at our produce?

Entry.JapaneseText: 女王様のお披露目はもうすぐ！ 見物のお弁当に使う食材も、 うちで買っておくれ。
Entry.EnglishText: The Queen's inauguration ceremony is right around the corner! Why don't you buy some ingredients and pack yourself a lunch for the occasion?

Entry.JapaneseText: ウチの食材は、 せんさいなヒューマにこそ 食べてもらいたいね。
Entry.EnglishText: I only want my food to be eaten by Huma with refined palates.

Entry.JapaneseText: がさつなガジュマは 味わう事など知らんからの。
Entry.EnglishText: Those Gajuma have no taste for fine cuisine.

Entry.JapaneseText: ジルバ様が何を言おうが、 ワシらにはミルハウスト将軍が ついておる！
Entry.EnglishText: I don't care what Lady Zilva says, we have General Milhaust on our side!

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマの思いどおりにはならん。 お客さんもそう思うだろう？
Entry.EnglishText: Those Gajuma aren't going to get their way! Wouldn't you agree?

Entry.JapaneseText: なんだか、以前より毎日が 楽しくないんじゃ…… どうしてだろうなぁ……
Entry.EnglishText: I'm just not enjoying living life like I used to... I wonder why?

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマのために薬を探した 娘さんがおったそうじゃ…… 以前はワシらも助け合っていたのに……
Entry.EnglishText: A young girl stopped by the other day looking for medicine for a Gajuma... We all would have done the same back in the day, but...

Entry.JapaneseText: ワシは反省した！ ヒューマもガジュマも ヒトはヒト！
Entry.EnglishText: I've done some soul-searching! It doesn't matter whether someone is Huma or Gajuma, they're all my fellow <Yellow>Man<White>!

Entry.JapaneseText: そう思っていた頃のほうが 今よりずっと楽しかった！ それでいいんじゃ！
Entry.EnglishText: I'm enjoying life again now that I've remembered that!

Entry.JapaneseText: バルカはこんなに広いのに、 食材はウチだけ、ウチだけだよ！ バルカ七不思議のひとつさ！
Entry.EnglishText: Balka is such a huge city, and yet we're the only grocery store around! We're one of the Seven Wonders of Balka!

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマには売らんと 言ったら売らんのだ！ 帰っておくれ。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm not selling to Gajuma! Please leave.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマのお客さんが来ると ホッとするよ……と言っても、 ガジュマには売ってないけどね。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm always happy to have Huma customers...but it's not like I sell to Gajuma, anyway.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 食材を買う 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Buy Ingredients Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: いつでも買いに 来ておくれよ！
Entry.EnglishText: You're always welcome to shop here!

Entry.JapaneseText: バルカの食材屋はウチだけ！ お忘れなく！
Entry.EnglishText: We're the only grocery store in Balka! Don't you forget it!

Entry.JapaneseText: 何？ 病気を治す薬？
Entry.EnglishText: Huh? You're looking for medicine?

Entry.JapaneseText: 残念じゃが、うちは食材屋じゃ。 薬は取り扱っとらん。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm sorry, but this is a grocery store. We don't sell medicine here.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ガジュマには売りたくない。 帰っておくれ……
Entry.EnglishText: I have no desire to do business with Gajuma. Please leave.

Entry.JapaneseText: 地震が来ようと、矢が降ろうと バルカの食材屋は営業中じゃ！ 買っていっておくれ。
Entry.EnglishText: Even if there's an earthquake or if it rains arrows, Balka's grocery store will always remain open! Go ahead and buy something.
Entry.Notes: this is one of those jp idioms. marking problematic. should probably be "whether it's rain or shine" or "come hell or high water". also beware the line break. -dragon

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 食材を買う 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Buy Ingredients Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: いつでも買いに 来ておくれよ！
Entry.EnglishText: You're always welcome to shop here!

Entry.JapaneseText: バルカの食材屋はウチだけ！ お忘れなく！
Entry.EnglishText: We're the only grocery store in Balka! Don't you forget it!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマにもガジュマにも バルカの食材屋は販売中じゃ！ 買っていっておくれ。
Entry.EnglishText: We sell to both Huma and Gajuma here at Balka's grocery store! Go ahead and purchase something.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 食材を買う 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Buy Ingredients Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: いつでも買いに 来ておくれよ！
Entry.EnglishText: You're always welcome to shop here!

Entry.JapaneseText: バルカの食材屋はウチだけ！ お忘れなく！
Entry.EnglishText: We're the only grocery store in Balka! Don't you forget it!

Entry.JapaneseText: ラジルダが崩壊しようが 天変地異が起ころうが、 バルカの食材屋は営業中じゃ！
Entry.EnglishText: Even if Razilda has been destroyed or there are natural disasters occurring, we here at Balka's grocery store will remain open for business!

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 食材を買う 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Buy Ingredients Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: いつでも買いに 来ておくれよ！
Entry.EnglishText: You're always welcome to shop here!

Entry.JapaneseText: バルカの食材屋はウチだけ！ お忘れなく！
Entry.EnglishText: We're the only grocery store in Balka! Don't you forget it!

Entry.JapaneseText: 首都バルカの食材屋は ここだけじゃ。 買っていっておくれ。
Entry.EnglishText: This is the one and only grocery store in the capital city of Balka. Go ahead and buy something.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 食材を買う 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Buy Ingredients Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: 売り切れる前に 買いに来ておくれよ！
Entry.EnglishText: Make sure to buy before I'm sold out!

Entry.JapaneseText: バルカの食材屋はウチだけ！ お忘れなく！
Entry.EnglishText: We're the only grocery store in Balka! Don't you forget it!

Entry.JapaneseText: 泊まりたいの？ あいにく今日は予約が いっぱいなのよね。
Entry.EnglishText: You're wanting to spend the night? Unfortunately, we're completely booked.

Entry.JapaneseText: また来てちょうだい。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come back again.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……いらっしゃい、ませ。
Entry.EnglishText: W-Welcome.

Entry.JapaneseText: いらっしゃいませ。 お風呂とリフトでおなじみの 「カレギアの栄光」へようこそ！
Entry.EnglishText: Welcome to the Glory of Callegea, famous for its baths and elevators!

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 泊まる 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Rest Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: ……はい、そうですか。
Entry.EnglishText: Ah, is that so?

Entry.JapaneseText: 次回は、ぜひ泊まって 自慢のお風呂とリフトを 楽しんでくださいね。
Entry.EnglishText: Next time, please stay and enjoy our wonderful baths and elevators.

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>ひと晩<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが いかがですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Would you like to stay the night?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 お泊りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Would you like to stay here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002><unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 お泊りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Will you be spending the night?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 お泊りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Would you like to stay here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 お泊りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Would you like to stay here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>泊まんのかい……？ <unk17:340C80>ガルド置いてきな。
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Stay here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドだけど、 泊まるかい？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>It's <unk17:340C80> Gald for a night. Will you be staying?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 お泊りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Would you like to stay here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 お泊りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Would you like to stay here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 お泊りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Would you like to stay here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドだけど、 泊まる？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Would you like to stay?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 よろしいでしょうか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Is that all right with you?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドになりますが、 お泊りですか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Would you like to stay here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002>一泊<unk17:340C80>ガルドだ。 どうする？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>One night is <unk17:340C80> Gald. Are you staying?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002><unk17:340C80>ガルドだけど泊まるかい？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>Spend <unk17:340C80> Gald to rest here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002><unk17:340C80>ガルドだけど泊まるかい？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>Spend <unk17:340C80> Gald to rest here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002><unk17:340C80>ガルドだけど泊まりますか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>Will you spend <unk17:340C80> Gald to rest here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <font:80000002><unk17:340C80>ガルドだけど泊まりますか？
Entry.EnglishText: <font:80000002>Will you spend <unk17:340C80> Gald to rest here?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140><font:80000002><unk17:340C80>ガルドで泊りますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140><unk17:340C80> Gald to rest. Spend the night? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりどうぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: Rest well.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Enjoy your stay.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Enjoy your stay.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Enjoy your stay.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Enjoy your stay.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくり。
Entry.EnglishText: Rest well.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Enjoy your stay.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Enjoy your stay.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Enjoy your stay.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくり。
Entry.EnglishText: Rest well.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお寛ぎください。
Entry.EnglishText: Rest well.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくりお休みください。
Entry.EnglishText: Enjoy your stay.

Entry.JapaneseText: どうぞ、ごゆっくり。
Entry.EnglishText: Make yourself at home.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくり。
Entry.EnglishText: Rest well.

Entry.JapaneseText: どうぞ、ごゆっくり。
Entry.EnglishText: Make yourself at home.

Entry.JapaneseText: ごゆっくり、どーぞー。
Entry.EnglishText: Have a good rest!

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようですね。
Entry.EnglishText: You've got no money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: 金がないのに、 泊まる気だったのかい？
Entry.EnglishText: What, did you think we'd let you stay here without paying?

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないよ。
Entry.EnglishText: You don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないみたいね。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: 泊まり賃をお持ちでないようですが。
Entry.EnglishText: It doesn't look like you can afford to stay here.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようです。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems you don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: You don't have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: あれ？ お金が足りないみたいだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Huh? You seem to not have enough money.

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないんじゃが……
Entry.EnglishText: It appears you don't have enough money...

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りませんが……
Entry.EnglishText: You don't have enough money...

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足らないんですけど……
Entry.EnglishText: You don't seem to have enough money...

Entry.JapaneseText: それでは またの機会に。
Entry.EnglishText: See you next time.

Entry.JapaneseText: またお越しください。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: またどうぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: またお越しください。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: またお越しください。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ふん…… ひやかしかい……
Entry.EnglishText: Hmph... Window-shoppers...

Entry.JapaneseText: またおいで。
Entry.EnglishText: Come back any time.

Entry.JapaneseText: またお越しください。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: またお越しください。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: またお越しください。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: またおいで。
Entry.EnglishText: Come back any time.

Entry.JapaneseText: またのお越しを。
Entry.EnglishText: We hope to see you again.

Entry.JapaneseText: またお越しください。
Entry.EnglishText: Please come again.

Entry.JapaneseText: なんだ、 泊まらないのか……？
Entry.EnglishText: What, you're not going to stay?

Entry.JapaneseText: いつでもどうぞ！
Entry.EnglishText: You're always welcome here!

Entry.JapaneseText: いつでもおいで。
Entry.EnglishText: Come back any time.

Entry.JapaneseText: お気をつけて……
Entry.EnglishText: Take care...

Entry.JapaneseText: 泊まらないんですか？
Entry.EnglishText: Do you not want to stay here?

Entry.JapaneseText: またのご利用は、あまり お待ちしていませんから。
Entry.EnglishText: I won't be waiting too long to see you again, I hope.

Entry.JapaneseText: またのご利用を お待ちしています。
Entry.EnglishText: We look forward to serving you again.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマには毛皮や羽があるし、 体も丈夫なんだから、外で 寝泊りしたらどうかしら？
Entry.EnglishText: Since you Gajuma have fur and feathers to cover your strong bodies, won't you be okay sleeping outside?

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマが泊まると、お布団も お風呂も、毛や羽だらけで、 掃除が大変なのよね……
Entry.EnglishText: Whenever a Gajuma lodges with us, they leave the bedding and bathtubs full of either hair or feathers... It's such a mess to clean up...

Entry.JapaneseText: ジルバ様は、ガジュマが ヒューマに虐げられていると 言ったそうだけど……
Entry.EnglishText: Lady Zilva said that Gajuma are being oppressed by Huma...

Entry.JapaneseText: どっちもどっちなんじゃ ないかしら……？
Entry.EnglishText: But doesn't it go both ways?

Entry.JapaneseText: 国の偉い人は、ガジュマだけを 守るつもりなのかしら？
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder if our kingdom's leaders are only going to protect the Gajuma?

Entry.JapaneseText: ミルハウスト様は、それで いいと思ってるのかしらね？
Entry.EnglishText: Would General Milhaust go along with such a thing?

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマが喜ぶような話、 何もありません……
Entry.EnglishText: I have nothing to say that would make a Gajuma happy.

Entry.JapaneseText: 世の中はずいぶんと すさんできましたね……
Entry.EnglishText: The world has become a very depressing place.

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、私もその世の中の 一員なんですよね……
Entry.EnglishText: But I too am a part of that world.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマを助けた ヒューマの娘さんが いたんですって……
Entry.EnglishText: There was a Huma girl who went out of her way to help a Gajuama...

Entry.JapaneseText: その話を聞いて、なぜだか とても嬉しかったの……
Entry.EnglishText: For some reason, hearing that made me happy...

Entry.JapaneseText: 種族が逆の話だったら、 あなたは……嬉しいと思う？
Entry.EnglishText: If the races were reversed, would you be happy as well?

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、もちろんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Yes, of course.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマを助けた ヒューマの娘さんが いたんですって……
Entry.EnglishText: There was a Huma girl who went out of her way to help a Gajuama...

Entry.JapaneseText: その話を聞いて、なぜだか とても嬉しかったんです……
Entry.EnglishText: For some reason, hearing that made me happy...

Entry.JapaneseText: 食材屋さんとも話し合ったんです。 種族の事でケンカしてても、 楽しい事なんて何もないって……
Entry.EnglishText: I spoke with the grocer. He agreed that nothing good has ever come from bickering over race...

Entry.JapaneseText: だから、他の人がどう言おうと 私たちは、種族に関係なく、 <Yellow>ヒト<White>としてお客様に接しようって。
Entry.EnglishText: So no matter what others say, we've decided to treat our customers as our fellow <Yellow>Man<White> without regard for race.

Entry.JapaneseText: 当宿の豪華なお風呂に 浸かれば、旅の疲れなんて すぐにとれますよ。
Entry.EnglishText: A soak in our luxurious baths make you forget the fatigues of your travels in no time.

Entry.JapaneseText: 当宿のリフトは静かで快適。 自慢のリフトなんですよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Our elevators are quiet and enjoyable to use. We take great pride in them.

Entry.JapaneseText: うちは宿屋だしねえ、 薬は売ってないわね……
Entry.EnglishText: We're an inn. We don't sell medicine.

Entry.JapaneseText: 泊まりたい？ じゃあ、 もう少し日が暮れてから いらっしゃい。
Entry.EnglishText: Do you want to stay the night? If so, please come back later in the day.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……いらっしゃい、ませ。
Entry.EnglishText: W-Welcome.

Entry.JapaneseText: いらっしゃいませ。 お風呂とリフトでおなじみの 「カレギアの栄光」へようこそ！
Entry.EnglishText: Welcome to the Glory of Callegea, famous for its baths and elevators!

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 泊まる 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Rest Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: ……はい、そうですか。
Entry.EnglishText: Ah, is that so?

Entry.JapaneseText: 次回は、ぜひ泊まって 自慢のお風呂とリフトを 楽しんでくださいね。
Entry.EnglishText: Next time, please stay and enjoy our wonderful baths and elevators.

Entry.JapaneseText: またのご利用は、あまり お待ちしていませんから。
Entry.EnglishText: I won't be waiting too long to see you again, I hope.

Entry.JapaneseText: またのご利用を お待ちしています。
Entry.EnglishText: We look forward to serving you again.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ど、どうも…… よくおこしくださいました……
Entry.EnglishText: Hello... Thank you for coming...

Entry.JapaneseText: いらっしゃいませ。 お風呂とリフトでおなじみの 「カレギアの栄光」へようこそ！
Entry.EnglishText: Welcome to the Glory of Callegea, famous for its baths and elevators!

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 泊まる 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Rest Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ま、またどうぞ……
Entry.EnglishText: Please visit us...again...

Entry.JapaneseText: 次回は、ぜひ泊まって 自慢のお風呂とリフトを 楽しんでくださいね。
Entry.EnglishText: Next time, please stay and enjoy our wonderful baths and elevators.

Entry.JapaneseText: またのご利用を…… お、お待ちしています……
Entry.EnglishText: W-We look forward to serving you again.

Entry.JapaneseText: またのご利用を お待ちしています。
Entry.EnglishText: We look forward to serving you again.

Entry.JapaneseText: いらっしゃいませ。 お風呂とリフトでおなじみの 「カレギアの栄光」へようこそ！
Entry.EnglishText: Welcome to the Glory of Callegea, famous for its baths and elevators!

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 泊まる 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Rest Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: 次回は、ぜひ泊まって 自慢のお風呂とリフトを 楽しんでくださいね。
Entry.EnglishText: Next time, please stay and enjoy our wonderful baths and elevators.

Entry.JapaneseText: またのご利用を お待ちしています。
Entry.EnglishText: We look forward to serving you again.
